aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm

Class Loop

  • java.lang.Object
    • aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm.Loop

  • public class Loop
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the representative of the LOOP-matrices used for the Geometric Non-Termination Analysis.
    Author:
    Timo Bergerbusch
    See Also:
    GeoNonTermAnalysis, Logger

    • Field Detail

      • SHOULD_PRINT

        private static boolean SHOULD_PRINT
        a static boolean to determine if the information about the process should be printed using the Logger.

      • guardMatrix

        private GNAMatrix guardMatrix
        the guards depending on the variables.
        often referred as G.

      • updateMatrix

        private GNAMatrix updateMatrix
        the update in every step of the iteration only within the rule without regarding the guards.
        often referred as M.

      • iterationMatrix

        private GNAMatrix iterationMatrix
        the matrix which describes a complete iteration step. It is computed as 
         
        G  0
  A = ( M -I )
       -M  I

      • guardConstants

        private GNAVector guardConstants
        the constants corresponding to the guardMatrix

      • updateConstants

        private GNAVector updateConstants
        the constants corresponding to the updateMatrix

      • iterationConstants

        private GNAVector iterationConstants
        the constants corresponding to the iterationMatrix. It is computed as 
         
        g
  b = (-m)
        m

        the default constructor. No other functionality so far.

    • Method Detail

      • computeIterationMatrixAndConstants

        public void computeIterationMatrixAndConstants()
        computes the iterationMatrixA and iterationConstants b as 
         
        G  0             g
  A = ( M -I ) and b = (-m)
       -M  I             m

      • getSystemAsString

        public static java.lang.String getSystemAsString(GNAMatrix matrix,
                                                 java.lang.String[] names,
                                                 GNAVector constant)
        returns the matrices in a simple-to-read way. It should be the typical mathematical form.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to multiplicate with
        names - the vectoritems to multiplicate with
        constant - the constant factor
        Returns:
        the matrices in mathematical form

      • getSystemAsString

        public static java.lang.String getSystemAsString(GNAMatrix matrix,
                                                 GNAVector vec,
                                                 GNAVector constant)
        returns the matrices in a simple-to-read way. It should be the typical mathematical form. Using getSystemAsString(GNAMatrix, String[], GNAVector).
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to multiplicate with
        vec - the vector to multiplicate with
        constant - the constant factor
        Returns:
        the matrices in mathematical form

      • getFrontString

        private static java.lang.String getFrontString(int rowNumber,
                                               int cap)
        a helping function for getSystemAsString(GNAMatrix, String[], GNAVector). It finds the best fitting matrix opening symbol for a row with respect to the cap.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - the row within the matrix
        cap - the max. number of rows
        Returns:
        a top left, mid oder bottom left matrix opening symbol

      • getBackString

        private static java.lang.String getBackString(int rowNumber,
                                              int cap)
        a helping function for getSystemAsString(GNAMatrix, String[], GNAVector). It finds the best fitting matrix closing symbol for a row with respect to the cap.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - the row within the matrix
        cap - the max. number of rows
        Returns:
        a top right, mid oder bottom right matrix closing symbol

      • printInformationString

        public void printInformationString()
        prints the matrices and corresponding constants if they are initialized as a simple string.
